abilityshield: Holder's Ability cannot be changed or nullified by any effect (e.g., Gastro Acid, Weezing's Neutralizing Gas). Useful on Ogerpon or Terapagos to maintain key abilities.
absorbbulb: Consumable. Raises Special Attack by 1 stage if hit by a Water-type move. Niche use on special attackers paired with Surf users.
adrenalineorb: Consumable. Raises Speed by 1 stage if the holder is intimidated. Useful for competitive physical attackers to counter Incineroar cycles.
aguavberry: Consumable. Restores 33% max HP at 1/4 max HP or less; confuses if holder has -SpD nature. Standard recovery berry for bulky pivots.
airballoon: Holder is immune to Ground-type attacks. Pops when hit. Great for Electric-types or Steel-types (like Heatran/Gholdengo) to avoid Earth Power/Earthquake.
apicotberry: Consumable. Raises Sp. Def by 1 stage when at 1/4 max HP or less. Niche; sometimes seen on Endure strategies.
assaultvest: Holder's Sp. Def is 1.5x, but it can only use damaging moves. Staple on bulky attackers like Rillaboom, Tyranitar, and Iron Hands.
babiriberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Steel-type attack. Useful for Fairy-types facing Gholdengo or Heavy Slam users.
bigroot: Holder gains 1.3x HP from draining moves (Drain Punch, Horn Leech). Niche; occasionally used on bulky drain-tanks.
bindingband: Holder's binding moves (Wrap, Magma Storm) deal 1/6 max HP per turn instead of 1/8. Very niche.
blackbelt: Holder's Fighting-type attacks have 1.2x power. Consistent boost for Urshifu or Iron Hands without Life Orb recoil.
blackglasses: Holder's Dark-type attacks have 1.2x power. Standard on Kingambit or Chien-Pao for consistent damage.
blacksludge: Restores 1/16 max HP each turn if Poison-type; damages others. Leftovers equivalent for Poison-types (e.g., Amoonguss/Glimmora), punishes Trick users.
blunderpolicy: Consumable. Sharply raises Speed if the holder misses a move. Niche; used with low-accuracy moves like Hypnosis or Draco Meteor.
boosterenergy: Consumable. Activates Protosynthesis or Quark Drive immediately. The defining item of Gen 9 for Paradox Pokémon like Flutter Mane and Iron Hands.
brightpowder: The accuracy of attacks against the holder is 0.9x. Relies on RNG; generally outclassed by consistent bulk items.
cellbattery: Consumable. Raises Attack by 1 stage if hit by an Electric-type move. Very niche.
charcoal: Holder's Fire-type attacks have 1.2x power. Common on Torkoal, Chi-Yu, or Incineroar to boost Heat Wave/Flare Blitz.
chartiberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Rock-type attack. Useful for Flying/Fire types (Talonflame, Charizard/Chi-Yu) against Rock Slide.
chestoberry: Consumable. Cures sleep. Used on Rest sets (RestChesto) or to counter Spore/Hypnosis leads.
choiceband: Holder's Attack is 1.5x, but it can only select the first move it executes. massive power for wallbreakers like Dragonite, Urshifu, or Baxcalibur.
choicescarf: Holder's Speed is 1.5x, but it can only select the first move it executes. Essential for speed control; used on Urshifu, Landorus-T, or Chi-Yu.
choicespecs: Holder's Sp. Atk is 1.5x, but it can only select the first move it executes. Immediate nuke potential for Flutter Mane, Chi-Yu, or Terapagos.
chopleberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Fighting-type attack. Essential for Tyranitar, Kingambit, or Incineroar to survive Body Press/Close Combat.
clearamulet: Holder's stats cannot be lowered by other Pokémon. Premier anti-Intimidate/Icy Wind item for physical attackers like Baxcalibur, Gyarados, and Dragonite.
cobaberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Flying-type attack. Useful for Fighting/Grass types (Amoonguss, Urshifu) against Acrobatics/Brave Bird.
colburberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Dark-type attack. Vital for Ghost/Psychic types (Gholdengo, Armarouge, Cresselia) to survive Knock Off/Sucker Punch.
covercloak: Holder is immune to secondary effects of moves (flinch, burn, stat drops). Excellent for bulky supports to ignore Fake Out, Salt Cure, or Snarl drops.
custapberry: Consumable. Holder moves first in its priority bracket when at 1/4 max HP or less. Surprise factor for slow attackers to get a final hit off.
damprock: Extends Rain Dance duration to 8 turns. Staple for manual rain setters like Pelipper/Tornadus.
dragonfang: Holder's Dragon-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Draco Meteor/Dragon Claw without locking moves.
ejectbutton: Consumable. If holder survives a hit, it immediately switches out. Used on Prankster weather setters or support mons to cycle Intimidate/Terrain safely.
ejectpack: Consumable. If holder's stats are lowered, it immediately switches out. Combines with Draco Meteor/Overheat or Intimidate to pivot instantly.
electricseed: Consumable. Raises Defense by 1 stage on Electric Terrain. Great for Unburden Sneasler or bulky setup sweepers.
eviolite: If holder's species can evolve, its Def and Sp. Def are 1.5x. The reason Porygon2, Dusclops, and Clefairy are viable walls.
expertbelt: Holder's supereffective attacks deal 1.2x damage. Good for coverage-heavy attackers (e.g., Miraidon) who feign Choice items.
fairiumz: Z-Crystals are not legal in Gen 9 VGC.
figyberry: Consumable. Restores 33% max HP at 1/4 max HP or less; confuses if holder has -Atk nature. Standard burst healing for bulky attackers.
flameorb: At the end of every turn, this item attempts to burn the holder. Enabler for Guts users (Ursaluna, Conkeldurr) or Fling strats.
focusband: Holder has a 10% chance to survive an attack that would KO it with 1 HP. Unreliable; Focus Sash is preferred.
focussash: If holder has full HP, it survives a hit that would KO it with 1 HP. Single use. Essential for frail leads (Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane) to guarantee action.
fullincense: Holder moves last in its priority bracket. Niche; mainly used for Trick Room 'underspeeding' mechanics.
ganlonberry: Consumable. Raises Defense by 1 stage when at 1/4 max HP or less. Very niche.
grassyseed: Consumable. Raises Defense by 1 stage on Grassy Terrain. Common on Acrobatics Sneasler or bulky setup sweepers paired with Rillaboom.
gripclaw: Holder's partial-trapping moves last 7 turns. Niche; used with Magma Storm or Sand Tomb trap strategies.
habanberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Dragon-type attack. Helps Dragons survive the mirror match (e.g., Garchomp vs Garchomp).
hardstone: Holder's Rock-type attacks have 1.2x power. Basic boost for Rock Slide users.
heatrock: Extends Sunny Day duration to 8 turns. Staple for manual sun setters like Torkoal/Ninetales.
heavydutyboots: Holder is immune to entry hazards (Stealth Rock, Spikes, Sticky Web). Less common in VGC than Singles, but good for 6v6 or switching-heavy teams.
iapapaberry: Consumable. Restores 33% max HP at 1/4 max HP or less; confuses if holder has -Def nature. Standard burst healing.
icyrock: Extends Hail/Snowscape duration to 8 turns. Essential for Snow teams (Alolan Ninetales/Abomasnow).
ironball: Halves holder's Speed and makes it grounded. Used for Trick Room sweepers to 'underspeed' opponents or Gyro Ball users.
kasibberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Ghost-type attack. Critical for Gholdengo, Shadow Rider Calyrex, or psychic types.
kebiaberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Poison-type attack. Essential for Fairy-types (Flutter Mane/Sylveon) to survive Sludge Bomb.
kingsrock: Holder's attacks without a chance to flinch gain a 10% chance to flinch. Used on Maushold (Population Bomb) or multi-hit users for cheese strategies.
laggingtail: Holder moves last in its priority bracket. Used on Prankster supports (Trick) to force opponents to move last.
lansatberry: Consumable. Raises critical hit ratio by 2 stages when at 1/4 max HP or less. Niche setup item.
leftovers: At the end of every turn, holder restores 1/16 max HP. Win-con for bulky setup mons (Dondozo, Garganacl) to outlast opponents.
leppaberry: Consumable. Restores 10 PP to a move that has run out. Infinite recovery loops (Recycle) or anti-pressure strategies.
liechiberry: Consumable. Raises Attack by 1 stage when at 1/4 max HP or less. Niche.
lifeorb: Holder's attacks do 1.3x damage, but it loses 1/10 max HP after attacking. The standard for mixed attackers wanting power and flexibility.
lightclay: Reflect and Light Screen last 8 turns instead of 5. Mandatory for screens setters like Grimmsnarl or Alolan Ninetales.
loadeddice: Holder's 2-5 hit moves hit 4-5 times; Population Bomb hits 4-10 times. Core item for Scale Shot Dragonite/Garchomp and Icicle Spear Baxcalibur.
lucaronite: Mega Stones are not legal in Gen 9 VGC.
lumberry: Consumable. Cures any status condition. High value on physical attackers (Dragonite, Baxcalibur) to block Burn, or setup sweepers to block Sleep.
magnet: Holder's Electric-type attacks have 1.2x power. Basic boost for Regieleki or Miraidon.
magoberry: Consumable. Restores 33% max HP at 1/4 max HP or less; confuses if holder has -Spe nature. Standard burst healing.
mail: Cannot be given to hold in modern competitive formats.
mentalherb: Consumable. Cures attraction, disable, encore, heal block, taunt, torment. Mandatory on dedicated Trick Room setters (Farigiraf, Oranguru) to ignore Taunt.
metronome: Damage of moves used on consecutive turns increases. Used on Urshifu or Flutter Mane to punish passive play.
micleberry: Consumable. Next move has 1.2x accuracy when at 1/4 max HP or less. Very niche.
miracleseed: Holder's Grass-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Rillaboom's Grassy Glide.
mirrorherb: Consumable. Copies any stat boosts an opponent gets. Great counter to Defiant users or Setup sweepers (e.g., copying a Swords Dance).
mistyseed: Consumable. Raises Sp. Def by 1 stage on Misty Terrain. Used on bulky supports in Misty Terrain teams.
muscleband: Holder's physical attacks have 1.1x power. Lower boost than Life Orb but no recoil; decent filler.
mysticwater: Holder's Water-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Surging Strikes on Urshifu-Rapid or Kyogre.
nevermeltice: Holder's Ice-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Ice Spinner/Icicle Spear for Ice-types.
normalgem: Consumable. Holder's first Normal-type attack has 1.3x power. Only legal Gem in Gen 9. Used for Explosion or Extreme Speed burst.
occaberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Fire-type attack. Standard on Steel-types (Scizor, Gholdengo, Metagross) or Grass-types (Rillaboom/Amoonguss).
passhoberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Water-type attack. Useful for Fire or Ground types (Heatran, Ursaluna) in rain metas.
payapaberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Psychic-type attack. Useful for Fighting/Poison types (Urshifu, Sneasler) against Expanding Force.
petayaberry: Consumable. Raises Sp. Atk by 1 stage when at 1/4 max HP or less. Niche.
pixieplate: Holder's Fairy-type attacks have 1.2x power. Identical to Polkadot Bow? No, Plates are for Arceus, but boost valid for others.
poisonbarb: Holder's Poison-type attacks have 1.2x power. Basic boost.
powerherb: Consumable. Holder's two-turn moves complete in one turn. Enables instant Meteor Beam (Glimmora) or Electro Shot (Archaludon).
protectivepads: Holder's moves are untouched by contact effects (Rocky Helmet, Rough Skin, Baneful Bunker). Alternatives include Punching Glove/Covert Cloak.
psychicseed: Consumable. Raises Sp. Def by 1 stage on Psychic Terrain. Core item for Unburden Sneasler or Indeedee partners.
punchingglove: Holder's punching moves have 1.1x power and do not make contact. Excellent on Urshifu to ignore Rocky Helmet/Static/Flame Body.
quickclaw: Holder has a 20% chance to move first in its priority bracket. Pure RNG; rarely used competitively but technically valid.
rawstberry: Consumable. Cures burn. Niche; Lum Berry is strictly better unless you expect multiple status types.
razorclaw: Holder's critical hit ratio is raised by 1 stage. Used rarely; Focus Energy or Scope Lens preferred.
redcard: Consumable. If holder survives a hit, attacker is forced to switch. Disrupts setup sweepers or positioning; used on bulky supports.
rindoberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Grass-type attack. Useful for Water/Ground types (Gastrodon, Swampert) to survive Wood Hammer/Leaf Storm.
rockyhelmet: If holder is hit by a contact move, attacker loses 1/6 max HP. Best punish tool on redirectors (Amoonguss/Maushold) against Urshifu/Physical attackers.
roomservice: Consumable. Lowers Speed by 1 stage if Trick Room is active. Niche item to 'underspeed' inside TR.
roseliberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Fairy-type attack. Vital for Dragons (Roaring Moon, Dragonite) and Dark/Fighting types (Urshifu-S) to survive Moonblast/Dazzling Gleam.
safetygoggles: Holder is immune to powder moves (Spore, Rage Powder) and weather damage. Hard counter to Amoonguss; staple on Incineroar/Arcanine.
salacberry: Consumable. Raises Speed by 1 stage when at 1/4 max HP or less. Used in Endure+Reversal strats.
scopelens: Holder's critical hit ratio is raised by 1 stage. Combined with high-crit moves (Snipe Shot, Ivy Cudgel) for 50% crit rate.
sharpbeak: Holder's Flying-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Brave Bird/Acrobatics (if item not consumed, which is rare for Acro).
shedshell: Holder cannot be trapped (Shadow Tag, Arena Trap, Magma Storm). Counter to Gothitelle perish trap teams.
shellbell: Holder heals 1/8 of damage dealt. Inferior to Leftovers usually, but used in Level 1 cheese strats.
shucaberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Ground-type attack. Staple for Fire/Electric/Steel types (Incineroar, Heatran, Kingambit) to survive Earthquake.
silkscarf: Holder's Normal-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Extreme Speed (Dragonite) or Blood Moon (Ursaluna) damage.
silverpowder: Holder's Bug-type attacks have 1.2x power. Basic boost.
sitrusberry: Consumable. Restores 1/4 max HP when at 1/2 max HP or less. The most consistent burst heal; standard on most supports/bulky attackers.
smoothrock: Extends Sandstorm duration to 8 turns. Staple for Tyranitar/Hippowdon sand teams.
softsand: Holder's Ground-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Earthquake/High Horsepower.
spelltag: Holder's Ghost-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Shadow Ball/Astral Barrage.
starfberry: Consumable. Raises a random stat by 2 stages when at 1/4 max HP or less. Pure RNG; unviable.
stickybarb: Damages holder each turn; transfers on contact. Meme item; generally outclassed.
tangaberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Bug-type attack. Very rare; maybe for Psychic types vs U-turn.
terrainextender: Extends Terrain duration to 8 turns. Key for Rillaboom/Indeedee/Miraidon to maintain terrain control.
throatspray: Consumable. Raises Sp. Atk by 1 stage after using a sound move. Excellent on Farigiraf (Hyper Voice) or Sylveon (Hyper Voice) or Kommo-o.
toxicorb: At the end of every turn, this item attempts to badly poison the holder. Activates Poison Heal (Breloom) or Toxic Boost.
twistedspoon: Holder's Psychic-type attacks have 1.2x power. Boosts Expanding Force/Psychic.
wacanberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Electric-type attack. Used on Water/Flying types (Gyarados, Pelipper) to survive Thunderbolt.
weaknesspolicy: Consumable. If holder is hit supereffectively, raises Atk and Sp. Atk by 2 stages. High risk/reward; paired with screens or self-proc (e.g. Bulldoze Metagross).
whiteherb: Consumable. Restores all lowered stats to neutral. Counters Intimidate or offsets drops from Close Combat/Draco Meteor/Shell Smash.
widelens: Accuracy of holder's moves is 1.1x. Fixes consistency for Maushold (Population Bomb), Rock Slide users, or Hypnosis.
wikiberry: Consumable. Restores 33% max HP at 1/4 max HP or less; confuses if holder has -SpA nature. Standard burst healing.
wiseglasses: Holder's special attacks have 1.1x power. Inferior to Life Orb/Specs but no drawbacks.
yacheberry: Consumable. Halves damage taken from a supereffective Ice-type attack. Essential for Ground/Dragon/Flying types (Landorus, Garchomp, Dragonite, Tornadus).
zoomlens: Accuracy is 1.2x if the holder moves after the target. Good for slow attackers using low-accuracy moves.
